workflow.name: Auto-follow-up for canceled Calendly meetings with GPT-4, Loom & Asana
workflow.description:
## This n8n workflow automatically detects canceled meetings from Calendly, uses GPT to write a friendly follow-up message, and sends it via Gmail, complete with a personalized Loom video link. It also creates an Asana task to remind your team to follow up manually if needed.

Ideal for B2B consultants, agencies, and sales teams who want to salvage missed opportunities and stay top-of-mind with prospects after no-shows.

‚∏ª

## Who it‚Äôs for

Sales teams, consultants, and agencies who rely on scheduled calls to close business  and want to re-engage leads who cancel or no-show using automated, human-sounding follow-ups.

‚∏ª

## How it works / What it does
1. A Calendly Webhook triggers the flow when a meeting is canceled.
2. Edit Fields extracts the meeting details (who canceled, when, and why).
3. A GPT-4 node writes a personalized follow-up email based on the meeting context.
4. You manually paste in your Loom video link.
5. A Merge node combines the AI-written message, user info, and video link.
6. Gmail sends the follow-up message automatically to the contact.
7. An Asana task is created for your team to track the missed call and optionally follow up manually.

‚∏ª

## How to set up
1. Create a webhook in Calendly and connect it to the Calendly Trigger node.
2. Add your OpenAI key in the Message a Model node.
3. Connect your Gmail and Asana accounts via n8n credentials.
4. Manually paste in the Loom video link in the Loom Link node.
5. Set your preferred Asana project and teammate in the Create a Task node.

‚∏ª

## Requirements

- A Calendly account
- OpenAI API key
- Gmail account with OAuth connected in n8n
- Asana account with access to a project and user ID

‚∏ª

## How to customize the workflow

- Update the GPT prompt to change the tone or add context based on your business.
- Replace Loom with a Vidyard, Tella, or custom-hosted video link.
- Add a Slack notification node to alert your sales team when a call is missed.
- Link with a CRM or Google Sheets to track follow-up activity across your pipeline.

This modular workflow helps you turn no-shows into new opportunities, while keeping your team organized and your leads engaged.

workflow.name: 002_ Loom Follow Up After Missed Meetings

parameters.content:
## üì© Auto-Follow Up After Missed Meetings

This workflow detects canceled meetings from Calendly, generates a personalized Loom follow-up email with GPT, and creates a task in Asana to ensure leads are never lost.
	‚Ä¢	GPT writes a friendly follow-up message tailored to the invitee.
	‚Ä¢	A Loom link is inserted into the email for a personal touch.
	‚Ä¢	An Asana task is created so your team can follow up manually if needed.

### Who it‚Äôs for
	‚Ä¢	B2B consultants, agencies, and founders who book calls via Calendly.
	‚Ä¢	Sales teams who want to automate lead recovery from no-shows.
	‚Ä¢	Anyone who wants to turn cancellations into conversations.

### How to Set Up
	1.	Create a Calendly webhook for the invitee.canceled event.
	2.	Add your OpenAI, Gmail, and Asana credentials in n8n.
	3.	Customize the GPT prompt in the Message a Model node.
	4.	Paste your Loom link into the Loom Link node.
	5.	Set your Asana assignee and project in the Create Task node.

### Requirements
	‚Ä¢	Calendly (for webhooks)
	‚Ä¢	OpenAI API Key
	‚Ä¢	Gmail account (OAuth)
	‚Ä¢	Asana account with project access

### How to Customize
	‚Ä¢	Update the GPT prompt tone or call-to-action.
	‚Ä¢	Automate the Loom link generation via API or AI later.
	‚Ä¢	Add a Slack notification node for internal visibility.

**Need Help?**

Join the [Discord](https://discord.com/invite/XPKeKXeB7d) or ask in the [Forum](https://community.n8n.io/).

## ‚öôÔ∏è Workflow Breakdown  
1. **Calendly Webhook Trigger:** Fires when a user cancels a scheduled event.  
2. **Edit Fields:** Extracts name, email, event type, and reason from the webhook.  
3. **GPT Message Generator:** Uses OpenAI to draft a personalized follow-up message.  
4. **Loom Link Injection:** Adds your pre-recorded Loom video URL to the output.  
5. **Merge:** Combines GPT message with user details and Loom link.  
6. **Send Gmail Message:** Sends the tailored follow-up via Gmail.  
7. **Create Asana Task:** Logs the missed call and Loom link for manual follow-up.

## üé• Demo Video  
üëâ **[Click here to watch the setup guide](https://www.loom.com/share/c3ea85bbb00c4640917983d3dba9a5ec?sid=ed62e4c9-9e3d-486e-a40c-e2056320b5ef)**

## Calendly Trigger
[Read more about Calendly Credentials](https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/builtin/credentials/calendly/)

Starts the workflow when someone cancels a meeting.
Only runs when a scheduled call is canceled.. no extra filters needed.

## Edit Node
[Read more about Edit Node](https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/builtin/core-nodes/n8n-nodes-base.set/)

Pulls out the important info from the canceled meeting:
‚Ä¢ Type of meeting
‚Ä¢ Name and email of the person
‚Ä¢ Date and time
‚Ä¢ Reason for canceling













This step helps keep everything simple and easy to use later.

## Write Message with AI
[Read more about Chat Model node](https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/builtin/cluster-nodes/sub-nodes/n8n-nodes-langchain.lmchatopenai/)

Uses AI to write a personal message for the person who canceled.
The message:
‚Ä¢ Says it‚Äôs okay they canceled
‚Ä¢ Summarizes what the call was about
‚Ä¢ Offers to reschedule

## Add Video Link & Finalize Message
This step adds your Loom video to the AI-written message, then combines everything into one complete email.

It takes:
	‚Ä¢	The custom message written by AI
	‚Ä¢	The Loom video link you provided
	‚Ä¢	The person‚Äôs name and email

And merges them into a single, ready-to-send message.

## Send Email with Gmail
[Read more about Gmail node](https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/builtin/app-nodes/n8n-nodes-base.gmail/)

Sends the follow-up email using your Gmail account.
It includes the message, subject line, and Loom video.

Make sure your Gmail is connected first.

## Create Task in Asana
[Read more about Asana node](https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/builtin/app-nodes/n8n-nodes-base.asana/)

Makes a task in Asana to remind your team to follow up.
The task includes:
‚Ä¢ Name of the person
‚Ä¢ A note that an email was sent
‚Ä¢ Link to the Loom video

It also assigns the task to your teammate and adds it to a project.

values.content:
=You are a helpful assistant that writes friendly, casual emails in a warm and natural tone.

Write only the email body ‚Äî do not include a subject line or greeting like ‚ÄúSubject:‚Äù
Use this context: [insert payload here]

=Write a short, friendly follow-up email for someone who just canceled our scheduled meeting. Their name is {{ $json["payload"]["invitee"]["name"] }}.

Keep the tone casual and warm.

Let them know it‚Äôs totally fine, but you recorded a quick Loom video in case they still want to check it out. End with a light invitation to reschedule if they‚Äôd like.

assignments.name: subject
assignments.value: Sorry we missed each other ‚Äî here‚Äôs a quick video

otherProperties.notes:
=Missed meeting with {{ $json.payload.invitee.name }}.
Email sent with this Loom: {{ $json.loom_link }}
